title: The Native American Artist Harnessing ‘Old Indian Tricks’
description: Hock E Aye Vi Edgar Heap of Birds uses a distinctive form of printmaking to convey the power of his people.
media:credit: Caitlin Ochs for The New York Times
media:description: Ghost prints by the artist Hock E Aye Vi Edgar Heap of Birds are “this great metaphor for where Natives are today in this country,” he said. “They’re very faint, they’re very diminished.”
